Reviews.Author: Mario D. Sanchez "milosancho"
Reviews.Content: I love this little Canon. The quality of the pictures is great. The screen size is great. Everything about it, it starts up very fast ready to take a picture in less than 2 seconds from the time you press the on button. The flash is plenty bright for such a little camera. The battery life if very good, still have not had to re-charge from its initial charge of many days ago. Love this little Canon.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot SD870IS is Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: C. F. Tuttle "SirCharles"
Reviews.Content: Small but mighty.  Large 3" screen makes composing shots and viewing takes simple and precise. The anti shake feature helps reduce blurred images. The 8mp capacity provides a wide range of printable image options.  On the down side - the camera has so many features, it's hard to keep track of them all without carrying the booklet with you.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: CJ
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great segway for people looking to get more experience in photography, without taking the plunge just yet into SLR's. I highly recommend it to anyone who's looking for a digital camera that does more than just "meet their needs"!

Reviews.Title: Best Point and Shoot I've Owned
Reviews.Author: Daniel Steingart
Reviews.Content: Needed a small camera for my honeymoon, did some research and this came up as solid across a few sites.  I am quite happy with it.  The wide angle works as advertised, battery life is good enough to get me through a day of intense shooting without a problem, and the movie mode was a surprise bonus: I used it far more than I thought I would.

Reviews.Title: Spectaculr Camera at a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Kenneth J. Schaefer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in the market for a new camera after the untimely death of our Sony camera.  I read as many reviews on point and shoots as I could and decided on this unit from Canon.  I must confess that I am a huge Canon fan from the 35mm film days and still own my A1 though it never sees use any longer.This camera has more than exceeded our expectations.  It is a wonder in all lighting conditions - dim light was a big problem for our Sony.  Not this camera!  Even in the dimmest light, it captures true skin tone . . . WOW!  We have now used the camera for about 30 days and it has performed above expectation at every turn.  You simply cannot buy a better camera for the price.  Highly, Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera with all the bells and whistles!
Reviews.Author: Jason Salmon "travel doc"
Reviews.Content: This camera is both quite simple and adequately complex at the same time.  I can use it easily as a great point-and-shoot and love the pics but also learn something new every week that it can do.  The sky seems to be the limit with this camera.

Reviews.Title: very nice and compact camera
Reviews.Author: J. J. huang "Anti-Ipodder"
Reviews.Content: this Canon sd870 is very nice, it is compact and stylish, and the pictures quality is very good, and plus the 3 inches big LCD, cannot complain much.Cons:none so far,

Reviews.Title: Nice, pocket-sized camera
Reviews.Author: N. PFEIFFER
Reviews.Content: Everything is great.  Too cons...no place to put your right thumb when taking a photo and it the photos are below average when zooming inside.  Otherwise, it is great, easy to use, and we love the big view screen.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I have ever owned.
Reviews.Author: J. O. Jones
Reviews.Content: Bar none this is the best camera I have ever owned.  Small, easy to use, yet takes fantastic pictures.  Lots of different functionality for the more advanced users, ease of use for the novice.  Easy to carry on vacation to the beach or to the kids talent show.  Quality of the video files it takes looks better than that of some video cameras I have owned.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: jude
Reviews.Content: This digital camera is slim and easy to use.  It makes taking pictures fun!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Remital
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera.  I love the point and shoot, and easy to fit in the pocket type cameras.  I had the SD500 since it first came out about 2.5 yrs ago.  Loved it, but the SD870IS is definitely a step forward.  I love the Image stabilization.  Even my wife can shoot good pictures.  Very easy to learn and use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Karen Leverette
Reviews.Content: This camera is sleek, slim and a pleasure to use.  Great pictures and easy to use.  Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Steven Nguyen "nguyensteven"
Reviews.Content: Nice camera for the price. Takes very nice pictures and has nice functions. The only con is that it could be a little smaller.

Reviews.Title: the best
Reviews.Author: Kathy Figueiredo
Reviews.Content: i just love this camera it takes such beautiful sharp pictures. i cant believe how clear they come out even thou i have the shaky hands. im so glad i bought this one it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: LL
Reviews.Content: Excellent!  Beautiful pictures----excellent colour, clarity and no fuzzyness when taking pics (which was a problem with both of my other cameras).Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product!  Great Transaction!
Reviews.Author: CfromHouston
Reviews.Content: I'm a novice when it comes to photography, but I was really impressed with this camera/video recorder when I saw the quality of pictures and video it produced. And just because it's small doesn't mean you can't add to it.  I actually made a diffuser out of bubble wrap to fit over the lens, and it's amazing how much more warm and full the pictures are (for up close portraits that is).  This camera is compact, yet powerful.

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera...so glad we got it
Reviews.Author: Finley Robinson "firobinson"
Reviews.Content: my wife is a professional photographer and we needed a little camera to have around and to keep in her purse. we've really enjoyed the Canon SD870IS. the screen is huge and the colors are really good. it helps to have some camera knowledge about ISO and Exposure because you can change some of the setting to get better pictures. we really love it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product!
Reviews.Author: Ivan Muriel
Reviews.Content: The Canon Powershot SD 870 take very high quality pictures at a very fast speed, the wide angle allows you to take pictures closer than other cameras. I you are looking for one digital camera this one is the one you should buy, it is simply a 5 stars camera!

Reviews.Title: Exceptional
Reviews.Author: Cejer106
Reviews.Content: I'm a "point-n-click" guy. This camera is GREAT. The image quality is superb, motion picture capture is great, software for PC reviewing is great. I just wish that Canon had included a 2GB extreme III memory card with the purchase. The wimpy memory card that comes with the camera took 5 picture + 60 seconds of video, then was full - geez. I did a LOT of research before buying this camera & my wife & I are thrilled with this purchase - just be sure to get a nice memory card in addition. Also - We picked up a very nice camera case from Fry's made by LowePro for $9.99 - I'd recommend you get your camera 1st, then go shop in a local store for the case; the Canon carrying case for $40 just seemed too expensive.

Reviews.Title: Canon Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Tomren "nordic traveler"
Reviews.Content: I have taken thousands of high quality digital images with this camera and highly recommend it for its small size, image stabilizer and long life rechargeable battery.  The optical zoom of 3.8X can be increased to 15X when there are sharply defined edges.  The camera works great for quick action nature photography.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: jaws1878 "jaws1878"
Reviews.Content: Great point and shoot camera. Good quality shots with enough extra features to keep the average photographer very happy. A bit more expensive than similar models out there but I think it is money well spent for the sleek design and ease of use. Recommended .

Reviews.Title: Canon SD870IS review
Reviews.Author: David L. Wandera "WanderaD"
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice camera. Pictures taken in the daylight look excellent. Still have some problems with pictures taken in the dark (with the flash), but I have read some reviews about tuning the ISO to fix this. Apart from that the product is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Grace Y. Lai
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom.She is not a camera person, but she can handle this camera easily with it's big 3" Screen, wide angle, and image stabilization!Love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Hart "Volleyhart"
Reviews.Content: Love this camera, it replaced a Sony Cybershot and it's completely lived up to my expectations.  I'm certainly nothing more than a casual user, typically I use it for real estate photos so the wide-angle and image stabilization have been handy.  I imagine they'd be helpful to just about anyone who's the same as I am ... someone who doesn't need lots of bells and whistles.  I've been very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: GA Peach
Reviews.Content: This camera was the talk of our Christmas parties this year, as it is just so easy to use.  The large display allowed even our old eyes to see if we needed to retake those important shots.  This is a must-have camera for point & shoot folks like us!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Gerardo Arias "Jerry"
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say that this camera has it all. It works out in any situation. If you are looking into purchasing this camera, well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Crisp and Clear pictures!
Reviews.Author: Gravefiller
Reviews.Content: I've had 3 canon cameras now.My SD450 which my girlfriend has takes great pictures as well, but it's night and day when you get your hands on this beauty.First off, that 3 in. LCD screen is just incredible.  You can see everything in great detail with it's screen size.And the pictures are sweet as well.You have like 12 different preset scene modes for night, beach, foliage, pets & kids, etc. etc... you can't blow the picture for the life of you.I'm still learning everything, but it's easy to navigate with the scroll wheel, like on an mp3 player....Look, Buy it and you won't regret ever reading this review.....I only buy canon digital cameras, because their simply the best looking and best software package , and of course the images are stunningly clear!Cheerio!!!

Reviews.Title: Cannon Camera
Reviews.Author: Juraj Sprung
Reviews.Content: Excellent buy. The best digital camera I owned so far.  Fast delivery from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: absolutely great
Reviews.Author: sv
Reviews.Content: great point and shoot camera. video is very nice too. nice size and weight.the included battery charger is tiny and weighs nothing.everything works the way it should.

Reviews.Title: Good camera and service
Reviews.Author: David Young
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera, I did a lot of research and found this to be the best camera for the money.  Takes great pictures and very good quality video.  I was wanting a camera to take good video as well as great pictures.  I am very pleased with this camera.  When I got the camera it had a line of dead pixels on the viewing screen.  I told Amazon about it and had a new camera in about 4 to 5 days.  They paid for all the shipping also.  I am very pleased with the service I recieved.

Reviews.Title: nice color, even at night
Reviews.Author: Zhichen Zhao "Frederick"
Reviews.Content: This DC of Canon is one of the nicest pocket one nowadays. The color is nice, even at night without flash. It's quick to open, easy to catch a snap. Big screen make it really popular, used with ultra speed SD card, you'll relly feel the fashion of digital technique.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: Pierce D. Nunley MD
Reviews.Content: I had the 800IS and upgraded to this mostly for the added megapixel since I use this for professional pics in the OR.  It has a WIDE angle lens for a compact camera.  Color is great.  I have used pictures from this camera in publications.  Although there is no comparison at many levels between this and my Canon 1D MarkII, the final picture is just as good if your technique is right.  the screen is BIG on this unit.  Less room for controls, though.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Got Book!
Reviews.Content: It is simple to operate and take excellent pictures. The screen without fingure print affected is very cool.  Menu is easy to navigate.  UBS port cover design is flimsy and could be done better.  Overall, it is a good camera

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Everts
Reviews.Content: This camera is totally awesome. From the first day I received it. I just love it. Great shots up close and far away. What a great compact camera to take on a trip. We went to WDW and talk about some awesome pictures of the animals through the glass and no cages. Great camera!!!

Reviews.Title: Wide angle lens is worth every penny!
Reviews.Author: Jan Patrick Perisse
Reviews.Content: I was in doubt about buying this camera or SD850IS, as it has an optical viewfinder and is somewhat cheaper, but I'm glad I got this one. The wide angle lenses are unbelieveable. I never has a wide angle camera before, but from now on it will be a must!

Reviews.Title: great camera ! !
Reviews.Author: J. M. Taboada
Reviews.Content: this is a great camera, it has-great size-big screen-nice wide angle-image stabilizerI highly recommend this product to people that love great pictures and at the same time would not like to carry around a SLR.

Reviews.Title: Typically excellent Canon Digital Elph, easy to learn and use
Reviews.Author: A. Santiago Jr.
Reviews.Content: I have been a big fan of Canon's Digital elph Powershot cameras.  I've had the S400, S500, SD500, SD550, SD800IS and now the SD870IS.  Most of my family have also bought these cameras.  What I like is that once you have learned to use one, it's very easy to move up to another one of their cameras and the learning curve is short and sweet.  I have never had much of a complaint about these cameras.  I thought about not having the viewfinder but then realized I almost never used it on my previous cameras, so it's no big loss.  They say this camera is heavier than previous models but they all weigh about the same.  It is slightly larger though because it just barely fits in my Coach case made for these Canon's.  I also notice that this model has more black plastic than others, especially on that battery/SD slot door.  Fortunately they have never broken on me.  Build quality, picture quality is as good as any of their previous models.  My wife and kids along with myself really love these cameras so I doubt I'll switch to anything else anytime soon.  In fact I only research the Canon cameras when I plan to buy another one.  I don't bother with any of the others.  If you're looking for one of these Canon's, just pick the one in your budget range because they are all good.  I can't think of one that you would not be happy with.  They really packed a lot into these small cameras.  I really like the color swap, color accent, the Vivid, Black and White and Sepia photos.  The possibilities for creative photos in camera are endless, and easy.  Get one and start having some fun.  By the way, none of the 1/2 dozen or so Canon Elph's I've owned, or my spouses, kids, etc. have ever had a problem with their Canon, not one.  I even dropped one on concrete once and I just picked it up and continued taking photos (BUT DON'T DO THAT, it's a sick feeling).  Fortunately it only got a small scratch on the side of the camera and it didn't land on the open lens.  I noticed too that prices have dropped for these cameras, they are much more affordable now.  Just make sure you buy from a responsible, reputable dealer that you trust.  It's sometimes better to pay a little extra just to protect yourself from some online dealers that sell cameras not intended for US sales, thus you probably don't get a legitimate warranty.  [...]

Reviews.Title: First one didn't work long..
Reviews.Author: Glenn
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD870IS 8MP Digital Camera with 3.8x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Silver)First one we received only worked for a couple of days and then the lens got stuck in the extended position and wouldn't retract when the camera was turned off.  Amazon's exchange process was painless (Thanks Amazon) and we got a replacement in about 4 days.  So far this one is working great.  Photos and video are excellent.  There are a lot of settings and feqatures to play with on this camera and it will take a while to explore all of its capabilities.  Would have given it 4 stars if the first one wasn't a dud.

Reviews.Title: Bought A Default Canon Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Tan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera back in April this year through Amazon.  I didn't use it until the past week.  Then I found out that the Date/Time setting doesn't work. It's not a major problem, but it can be very annoying that whenever I turned on the camera, the Date/Time setting popped up.  I called Canon, I had to pay to ship in the camera to have it (a new camera) fix.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased with Camera
Reviews.Author: RickieB "Rickieb"
Reviews.Content: I bought this in December 2007 and have used it for 2 months now. Am really happy with the purchase.PROS:Excellent picture quality, the screen is great, its pretty easy to use (especially if you have used Canon cameras before...which I have), plenty of high ISO choices, the red eye removal function that eliminates red eye from existing pictures is excellent - my first stab at it made me think it was better than Iphoto and Shutterfly's photo editor. Camera starts up very quickly. Wide angle lens means you can take pictures with more content in the frame which is excellent when taking pictures of kids. When you need it you can take good quality video which, even when expanded on my 24 inch Mac, looks perfectly acceptable.Cons:By default placing your finger over a button shows a graphic of that button on the screen which gets in the way of the picture you are taking. I found it unnecessary and annoying but it was easy enough to switch off.Biggest problem I have had is with the software that came with it. The downloading software works without a problem but the image browser (which is like a picture explorer/finder) doesn't work with my Mac; the first time I load it up on the computer it works fine but after that it crashes on start up. When I did use it, I liked it but now its just an annoyance as after downloading I have to deal with a dialog box which informs me the program has crashed. I also run Skype and think it may be a conflict with the built in isight. Still...fact is that, for whatever reason, it doesn't work.I have seen good reviews for the Sony but I wasn't impressed by the smeary screen and the clumsy touch screen. The wide angle lens makes it a better buy than the Canon 850IS. I have been very happy with this camera and can thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Display stopped working
Reviews.Author: rarph
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera until the display stopped working.  And, of course it stopped working within days of when the warranty expired.  Canon's response was for me to purchase a refurbished camera from them at a reduced price or to send it in for repairs. If the camera only lasted a year, why would I want to buy another Canon?  And, for the price of what I'm sure it would cost to repair (and I will be without a camera for an unknown period of time) it's hardly worth repairing.  I will definitely look at another brand to replace this.  I just hate that electronics are so disposable these days--what a waste.

Reviews.Title: Lots of features, compact size, decent value.
Reviews.Author: J. Loftus "blueOrbit"
Reviews.Content: We bought the SD870IS to replace an old 5MP Minolta SLR-style camera that had a dead CCD.  The Minolta took great pictures, but it's bulky size made it impractical for carrying around and packing in a suitcase.The SD870IS is a nice size and easily fits in your pocket, purse, laptop bag, backpack... whatever.  Because of it's small size, most features can be accessed with one hand.The unit comes with some great features such as photo-stitching for panoramic pictures, color replacement, burst mode, etc... The zoom is acceptable for small environments, but doesn't quite cut it for something like taking a picture of a bird in a tree.The picture quality is good enough for casual pictures, but despite the 8MP CCD it pales in comparison to our old 5MP SLR-style camera.  Lesson learned?  It's about the lens, not the MP.  Low-light performance leaves something to be desired, but this is probably another function of the lens size.After about 6 months the unit became "twitchy" where we had to torque (twist) it to get anything but garble to show up on the LCD.  We sent it in for warranty repair and got it back in about a week.  The repair process was simple enough and they have an easy method for checking the status.  Two minor complaints about the repair... 1) Our unit came back with a #4 permanently written in Sharpie on the case; it seems like they could have used tape for that instead. 2) It came back with the Korean language setting turned on and I had to dig through the manual to figure out how to set it back to English; this must be a running gag at the repair center.Bottom line is it's a nice camera for casual use, but if picture quality is important then you should really be looking into an SLR-style camera... we'll be looking into getting our Minolta repaired.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot 870IS versus Panasonic Lumix TZ5
Reviews.Author: Marc Trevino
Reviews.Content: A month before I purchased the 870IS, I purchased and returned the Panasonic Lumix TZ5 (Thanks to Amazon for easy return process).  The TZ5 had a nice 10x optical zoom, but dissapointing picture quality and poor first shot delay.  Canon's 870IS is a small, lightweight camera with great picture quality and good first shot delay.  My only complaint with the 870IS is the date stamp only works in "postacard" mode (less megapixels or something).  I purchased caselogic's UNZ-2 small universal pocket camera case, which fits the 870IS perfectly. Caselogic UNZ-2 Small Universal Pocket w/Screen Protection (Blue/Silver)

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: S. Tellep
Reviews.Content: This camera is by far the best camera I have used yet! I love all the features it has. It may be a little confusing for some. But not so if you're familiar with digital cameras.

Reviews.Title: Perfect, brilliant, 11 out of 10!
Reviews.Author: M. C. Wiggins
Reviews.Content: I won't ramble on (there are enough of those reviews and I am not a technical person) so I will just say, from my non technical perspective this is a GREAT camera.I looked up loads of different makes and models and I probably would've found most ok but this camera takes great photos with good colors.  The different modes are useful (although I haven't found a good mode for indoors at night yet).If you are a technical wiz, ignore this review.  If you are looking for a camera to take great point and shoot photos...this is the puppy!I even bought the underwater casing which is AMAZING....thoroughly recommended.Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: a good deal
Reviews.Author: Quan Wei
Reviews.Content: I've bought this Canon Powershot SD870IS on Amason after comparing a lot of shops and prices. It's just as good as I anticipant and smaller than I thought. I bring it with me everyday now. I'd like to recommand this to my friends and other people.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: T. Tom
Reviews.Content: This is a great point and shoot camera in almost all respects. The build quality is excellent as is the 35mm wide angle lens and the videos out of the camera. As far as point and shoot 'take everywhere and anywhere' cameras go, the Canon SD870IS is one of the top ones.

Reviews.Title: Best Canon ELPH MODEL
Reviews.Author: Phi
Reviews.Content: This is the best model going in the Elph line  The 900 and 1000 have more pixels but are slower to operate and have a less useful lens.  The 870 has a wide angle fast lens and for most people is the best bet.  Plenty of pixels for most people.

Reviews.Title: Canon SD870IS
Reviews.Author: Liza S. Anderson
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter's b-day present and she's so please with this camera. She loves it.

Reviews.Title: Just as advertised.
Reviews.Author: One Cent
Reviews.Content: The Canon Powershot SD870IS is a very high quality product that takes great pictures.  The 3" LCD is gorgeous and I had no problems viewing it clearly even in bright sunlight.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous for photographing children
Reviews.Author: ubergooroo
Reviews.Content: I had a camera last year that just didn't cut the mustard because the shutter lag was sooo slow that I missed the shot every time.Not with the PowerShot SD870IS. Although, it is hard to find shutter lag speeds, this one is FAST. Even being an 8MP, it is ready for the next shot very quickly.Also the wide angle is great for the normal point and shoot shots you take of kids. The face detection focuses on the face so the shots are focused where you need them to be on a quickly moving child.I just love it so and do think that I will always look at Canon for cameras now.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Tommy R. Michaels
Reviews.Content: This camera is extremely easy to operate, is easy to understand, and the large screen really helps.  A great point and shoot camera.  I didn't realize until I got the camera that it is also capable of video as well as still images.  The video is easy to operate and has good image quality.  This is a replacement for a Canon Power Shot S50 that was about four years old and is much better.  I really like all the improvements and know I will enjoy this camera for many years.

Reviews.Title: Meets or Exceeds Expectations
Reviews.Author: K. Wezwick
Reviews.Content: This camera is at the nexus of portability and image quality.  A DSLR would have been fantastic but of course they're quite expensive. saying nothing about their portability.  A bridge camera would be a good intermediate step but again, they don't exactly slip into one's pocket.  The SD870 is small enough to throw in a pocket (or purse, i'm sure) and takes a quality image.  The movie mode has some fun extras (time lapse, color accent) as well.  The metal body exudes quality construction and the LCD on the back is nearly gigantic.  It's worth the extra money over the SD1000.  A fine step before graduating to a bridge camera.

Reviews.Title: Complete Rip off.....
Reviews.Author: Sandy257 "Sandeep"
Reviews.Content: I will make it sure never to buy anymore canon cameras or sure....My canon SD870IS has stopped working within one year of its use, the same old Lens Error issue.My understanding is that this is a common error for Canon cameras.....

Reviews.Title: A very average replacement to 800IS
Reviews.Author: Uttam Channegowda "Uttam"
Reviews.Content: I have been using my roomie's SD800IS for almost a year now and found it to be really an amazing point n shoot camera. When i decided to buy one, i thought of getting an improved version of the same. I read a few reviews and got this camera. The first shot that i took was in auto mode in a dimly lit room and the quality was not as i would get from my SD870. The image somehow had a Tunnel effect. It had light just at the middle of the subject and dark on the corners.. Confused, i took few more pics and found the same effect.  I took the same pic from SD800 and the quality was way better. No darkening on the edges.The camera somehow dissappoints me in terms of image quality. Day shots are awesome. No complaints.. but after hours, the camera is a completely an average piece.. Dissappointed. I misplaced my manuals and CD and unfortunately cannot even return it. so, i am trying to change the settings as mentioned in the discussions, here n elsewhere, but still no significant improvement.. got a bad piece i guess..

Reviews.Title: Not so bad
Reviews.Author: Christopher Morris-page
Reviews.Content: Very slow shutter time after about a years use, still using today, but the shutter is about done for and the camera is about to break :(

Reviews.Title: Problem with the Lens and LCD Screen
Reviews.Author: E. Rosario
Reviews.Content: This camera was sent to Canon /repair Center in the 3rd month of use and all due to the problem with the Lens. After that was working Ok, but, the problem with the LCd appear.... Canon Camera are not good !!!! I will not recommend Canon products all due to my experience with them... 280 USD was sent to trash... I hope Canon staff can read all our reviews and they can apologize to us all due tha they are selling defective units...

Reviews.Title: Grainy low light pictures, ineffective flash in low light, fragile
Reviews.Author: K. Hard "Sustainable Green Engineer"
Reviews.Content: All low light pictures are grainy. I have had this camera for a year now and have tried and tried different ways to improve the picture, to no avail. The flash is just now powerful enough and I can only assume the sensor is low quality to get such grainy pics. I have to literally get on the dance floor next to the married couple to get even a half decent picture of their first dance.This camera is very fragile. the first time I dropped it, it broke. I dropped it on wood so it was not like dropping on concrete, but my wife's Fuji Finepix camera has been dropped time and time again with just scratches all over, never broke. I had the Canon fixed, but for the price this one cost, you would expect it to be a little more resilient.

Reviews.Title: Inconsistent quality, broken sound
Reviews.Author: jkdm "jkdm"
Reviews.Content: We've had this camera two years and really tried to make it work.  While we've had some good pictures with this camera, far too many are downright poor quality - mainly blurry, not sharp.  Poor pictures in dim light as well.  Additionally, the sound has completely broken on the video, rendering it useless.  I am sad at how many pictures I have missed of my kids growing up due to this camera's poor quality.  We let it go on too long, that is our fault, but I sure regret spending that much money on such a poor camera.  Made me long for our old Canon G11.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but weak flash and terrible red eye reduction
Reviews.Author: MariMarc
Reviews.Content: Before buying this camera I had done a lot of research. I wanted to replace my then 6 year old Sony Cybershot DSC-P72 because I wanted a lighter and smaller camera with more optical zoom and some wide angle (my main focus). I thought that all cameras nowadays had a good flash and a good red-eye reduction, especially a brand like Canon. Little did I know!Pros: The wide angle and optical zoom are great, the camera is light and small and takes good pictures outdoors. It also takes good videos with good sound (of course it is not a camcorder!). The zoom feature does not work in video mode, though.Cons: The camera's flash is poor and the in-camera red-eye reduction is terrible. Lots of glaringly red eyes even after correcting all pictures in the camera. You can try a manual correction of the pictures that still show red eyes but most of the time the manual correction has no effect, either, and you cannot get rid of the red eyes. First of all it is a nuisance to have to correct red eyes in the camera. My now 7 year old Sony Cybershot does the correction automatically when the feature is turned on and takes much, much better indoor pictures. Like other reviewers mentioned already, the Canon SD870 IS takes very poor quality indoor pictures in settings with low light, even when using the flash. Indoors I can use the manual mode without flash when there is enough light. But in fairly dark settings I have to use the flash. This camera is almost useless for taking pictures in low light settings where one needs a flash.If I had to do it again I would buy the similar model of the Sony Cybershot I also looked at when buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Brian Duncan "btd1984"
Reviews.Content: After owning this camera, I will never go back to a camera that does not have a wide angle lens. I seriously had been looking for a camera like this for as long as I can remember. I love taking panoramic shots of historic buildings or natural scenery, and I could never fit everything into my pictures. You will be amazed at how much you can fit into one picture, even when standing close up to your subject.The picture quality is great for a pocket camera and I love the special features it has (like making everything black and white except for one color). Everyone always envies my camera, and I think it is far superior to almost all other pocket digital cameras that I have seen including many of Canon's newer models that I have seen.One of my biggest complaints with other digital cameras is the amount of blurry pictures that you discover when loading them onto your computer. So far I have had no blurry surprises, thanks to the camera stabilizer feature... also the LCD is so big and bright that you have a really good idea of what the picture will look like when blown up. And you can even view pictures on the LCD in direct sunlight with quite a lot of clarity.One more word of praise, you can turn on the camera and take a picture so incredibly fast that you will never have to worry about missing a "Kodak moment" again. Battery life is great, and picture reload time is also fast.Alright I'm searching for cons: I wish that there were more picture modes though... like there is no nature or sunset mode.Bottom line, buy this camera now!

Reviews.Title: Candid Camera
Reviews.Author: Damien F. Lowman "DFLOW"
Reviews.Content: This camera has not taken a poor picture yet, and will not fail in times of capture.

Reviews.Title: New Camera
Reviews.Author: Ronny Brehm
Reviews.Content: Not a whole lot of complaints other than I have a hard time getting non-blurry pictures inside sometimes.  I think I just have to play with it more.  Battery life is good.  Camera is build solidly.  The transfer software is easy to use.  The videos looks great.  Use the "night mode" anytime your inside and it's much better.  Bought an 8GB SDHC card for plenty of storage.  Each time I put it in and take it out of the case I'm extremely careful not to turn it on because the lens will pop out automatically and I read that it will break if it meets resistance.

Reviews.Title: Just right for me.
Reviews.Content: This camera is fun to use and takes great pictures.  It is my 5th Canon digital camera, and my favorite!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: C. POSEY "fwmomof2"
Reviews.Content: I wanted something small that was capable of quality photos. This is it!It fits nicely in my pocket. It has a pretty fast response time from off to snapping photos. My only disappointment is the quality of the digital zoom, it gets grainy. Overall I am very satisfied with my purchase though.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use... good results
Reviews.Author: Casual Camera User
Reviews.Content: This camera has been easy to use and produces high quality photos with excellent detail.  Using the LCD instead of a view finder takes a little getting used to and in some very sunny situations, I've guess at lining up the shot, but the results were still good.  The battery life is EXCELLENT!The only "cons" are the zoom is less than I had on my previous Fuji FinePix.  Also my 6 year old dropped the camera and the lense trim ring broke.  It still takes pictures, but the design of the lense trim is a bit odd. Despite this, I still love the camera!

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: C. CHAN
Reviews.Content: I've done so much research before purchasing this camera.  This camera is easy to use, and the pictures are great.  Cannon certainly lives up to its reputation with this camera.  I love the wide angle feature when you have alot of people that need to be included.  The video works very well also.  For a portable video, the sound is okay, but much better than other point/shot degitial around my house.

Reviews.Title: Canon 870IS Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Gould
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD870IS 8MP Digital Camera with 3.8x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Silver)This is a wonderful camera! That is not to say it is not quite intimidating at first...because it is!There are many facets of this camera that will never be used by the average person. As one gets more familiar with the camera, it does feel more comfortable to use, and that is a good feeling. I am just getting the capability to interface this camera with a new computer, and will know more about the task in the next week or two.Basically, I would recommend this camera to anyone getting into digital photography. It's a beaut!

Reviews.Title: best little PnS!
Reviews.Author: T. Deller
Reviews.Content: perfect little point and shoot for capturing general day to day things.  the wide angle lens is a selling point on it's own, no complaints so far! very durable.

Reviews.Title: Holy Cow! I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Thompson
Reviews.Content: I researched which Canon camera to buy for weeks. I will not buy anything except a Nikon or a Canon. So I bought this because it seemed like it would pay for itself! And it has! It takes great photos, has TONS of features, battery life is really long, and the Image Stabilizer feature is really nice for people with shakey hands like me! I also like the fact that you can record short movies with this for when you don't have your camcorder. I bought a 2MB memory card and I haven't maxed it out yet. Oh, and the 3" display is AWESOME so you can see your pictures larger than other cameras I've seen.If you're an avid candid photo taker, this is for you when you're out at parties and whatnot. If you're a professional photographer, not quite that good--so stick with a more expensive camera, professionals.I am going to Vegas in a few months, and I plan on having this camera with me every step of the way! I LOVE THIS CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Ghayur
Reviews.Content: I have no complains after using it for over 1 month. The picture quality is pretty good. Compare to SD850IS, this one is better looking too :) especially the Black option.The small lid which covers the usb slot looks fragile. I feel that my 2 yr old will easily break it if he gets hold of the camera.Canon PowerShot SD870IS 8MP Digital Camera with 3.8x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)

Reviews.Title: Well worth the price
Reviews.Author: Billy J. Puryear "Who cares"
Reviews.Content: The camera is all it is advertized to be.  I was thoroughly pleased with everything about it.  I purchased it for $291, and three weeks after Christmas it was down to $249.  So do your research to find the best price.  The dealer on Amazon from whom I purchased the camera delivered well ahead of the promised time.  I would definitely use Amazon and this buyer again.

Reviews.Title: Just Love it!
Reviews.Author: Bruce Whitehead
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got the camera as a joint Christmas present. Our Grandkids visited us at Christmeas and we were snapping pictures right along.Very easy to use, we made a 25 sec video the first day.Pictures were of excellent quality. We chose the 5MB very fine format.The large 3" video monitor is just about perfect.We would lighly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good buy!
Reviews.Author: Jie Pan "Jie4Q"
Reviews.Content: The design could be a little bit more sleek compare to the other brands, but I like this camera overall.  The 3" LCD screen is a big plus.  The wide angle feature comes in handy when I want to take a big group picture.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot SD870IS
Reviews.Author: Donald C. Calvello
Reviews.Content: This camera replaced my Canon Powershot 750 which was stolen.  The 850 is a little more bulky, but still a compact size.  It also has image stabiliztion and the wide angle lens makes it far superior to the 750 and most other brands of digital cameras.

Reviews.Title: LCD went blank !!
Reviews.Author: Amit Khanna ""Analyzer""
Reviews.Content: Always had Canon cameras. "Upgraded" to this from SD1000 when we lost it in Disney World.Unfortunately on just its third weekend trip its LCD has stopped functioning. No view finder so for a perfectly good weekend we had to just "guess" and shoot. Right now I have been on hold with canon warranty 800# for about 20 min.Will update if I get good/ bad warranty service.Recommendation: Go for SD1000 or better new SD1100 with IS. It is smaller, almost as good and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: Nothing is Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Jesse J Henry "Bluenoser"
Reviews.Content: Really, nothing is perfect!  But all things considered, (PRICE!!!!! size!!!!!!) The Canon SD870IS is a pretty nice camera.  I bought this camera as a Christmas present for my partner.  She is in the real estate business and often has to take photos of houses outside and in.  The 28mm lens equivalent was the first big draw.  I looked at reviews for a handful of small point and shoot cameras with this size lens (equivalent).  I narrowed down the search to this Canon and started reading all the reviews, (not just on this site) and what I was gleaning  was that the camera was either GREAT!! or not so great because of noise at high ISO or speed of shooting.Remember this is a camera the size of a small pack of cigarettes for less that $300, read that again please......OF COURSE it is not going to be perfect, OF COURSE it will have some or a lot of noise at high ISO's, OF COURSE it is not going to have super fast shooting.......These things can be had on small point and shoots but you need to pay 5-10 times what this camera costs.  It is a very inexpensive camera, period....  What more could you possibly want from a camera this size at this price???  I remember the first digital cameras which cost close to $1000 and were so big they stored photos on old style floppy discs!!!!!Bottom line for me is you get what you pay for and what you are willing to sacrifice.  This is a camera with a very versatile form factor (what pocket won't it fit in??) and a very attractive price which can take great photos.

Reviews.Title: Unexplained noise in display; surprising lack of quality
Reviews.Author: top reviewer
Reviews.Content: Product appeared normal when received.  Noticed noise in display screen.  Took test photos in low light with my old 4MP Canon and this one to compare...my old camera looked better.  Consulted with local provider and person indicated this may have been damaged somehow.  Perhaps I received a defective product.

Reviews.Title: Canon wins again
Reviews.Author: G. North
Reviews.Content: People who want a true pocket camera cannot go wrong with the 870IS. The best features of the camera are:1)Image Stabilization-do not get a camera without this feature-it is the best innovation in photography since the digital camera itself.2)8.1 Megapixels - Provides sharp images which look great on a large monitor or over-size prints (up to 16x22).3)Great picture quality-colors very true-to-life.4)LARGE 3 inch LCD5)Stylish design fits into shirtpocket.6)The 28 MM wide-angle lens is more useful than a 10X optical zoom. Yes, there are many instances where optical zoom is desired, BUT more often than not, WIDE-ANGLE is the way to go.I have seen some reviews decrying the lack of a viewfinder and manual exposure controls.  That's like saying a Toyota Prius lacks the power of a Corvette and the room of a Ford Expedition!No viewfinder-who cares, who uses one any longer, especially with the gorgeous 3 inch LCD.  As far as manual exposure controls, I guarantee you virtually NO ONE who purchases a camera like this cares one whit about that.  99% of the time, AUTO works fine.  There are times, such as night or low-light shooting that you may want to use one of the special modes, but otherwise, who wants to fiddle with those? If you did, you wouldn't buy a point and shoot cam.Remember, every camera is a compromise between cost, size, performance and complexity. Canon has hit the target of a POS that takes great pics in a compact, easy to use camera!

Reviews.Title: I hate this camera. . .
Reviews.Author: R. Keyes
Reviews.Content: This camera is flawed.I've owned it since December 07.  I am not impressed with the pictures it produces - realistic distance for the flash to work properly is about half of what  it claims.  ISO setting is either 800 or 200 - I have never seen it choose anything in between.This thing is FRAGILE! Carrying around a baby chick would be easier to deal with.  Stick it in your pocket at your  peril - there is no time delay on the on off switch so it WILL turn on in your pocket on occasion with one simple press of the button.  The lens broke in a period of 3 three weeks due to this problem.  Sending it in to the factory to get it fixed under warranty was a nightmare - they claimed I dropped it (this is after speaking with someone and sending off a letter explaining what I believed happened).  Nobody read the letter - the first line of which was "This camera has NOT been dropped".  I got and email a few days later with the comment "This camera has been dropped".  >< -$100 grrrrI got it back and now the screen is splotched - big old dark spot on the LCD display.  Awesome!  Nice work guys!  I sooooo want to buy another Canon product!I want my money and my time back.There was something good about it but, for some reason, I can't think of what that was right now. . ..

Reviews.Title: easy , breezy picture taking
Reviews.Author: L. Lynn
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my 13 year old- she loves it- easy to use, picture quality is fabulous

Reviews.Title: I have owed 6 different PowerShots, They Are all GREAT!
Reviews.Author: C-review
Reviews.Content: Great compact camera. Pictures quality is very good.I chose this one because it has a nice large 3" screen.(you lose the optical viewfinder because of this, but I don't think you really need that on a compact camera anymore, leave it for digital SLR's).Overall I have been very pleased with all the Powershots!

Reviews.Title: Good Product and Delivered Promptly
Reviews.Author: Nikhil Mohan
Reviews.Content: I have ordered this product online from Amazon , and delivered to me promptly. Thanks for the Amazons service. I had read reviews about this and since I was looking for a sleek model , I decided to go for this. I just got the camera yesterday so cant write much...But I am satisfied very much with the performance.Canon SD850 and this one SD870 is almost similar, but this one has the wide angle feature and a big 3.5 LCD screen.

Reviews.Title: Excellent all around pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Frank Raymond "f2r2"
Reviews.Content: This is the one I have been waiting for - Very happy with it's performance

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I Have Ever Had By Far!
Reviews.Author: Michael Mamian
Reviews.Content: This an amazing camera. I have had, olympus, older canons, sony and this camera blows them all away. The picture quality is spectacular. It makes images seem even more beautiful than real life. The video is great for a little camera. The best part is it is very quick to take one shot after another for those times where you seem to always miss your kid smile. This way you just keep shooting. I couldn't be any happier.

Reviews.Title: Great Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Sharee A. Stroud "Sharee S"
Reviews.Content: This Camera is wonderful. Easy to use for just point an shoot shots. The manual settings are easy to learn and use too! So far I have had no problem with it. Cannon is a very well known name in camers so I trust them to provide a good product. This Camera ROCKS! I just bought it a few weeks ago as a present to my self for christmas. I am really looking forward to taken lots of photos. It takes crisp clean photos when on auto or when using the manual settings. I love having a big LCD screen. My last digital had about a 1 inch screen. I uploaded a photo I took with the macro setting. Amazing how close it got and it so clear. I would recommend this camera for sure. It's a bit more money than some of the other camera's out there (179.00) but I am worth it haha

Reviews.Title: Wonderful
Reviews.Author: Britney Suggs
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It's easy to use. My only complaint is it takes too long to focus and actually take the picture. It's great when i'm not trying to take pictures of my baby!

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: J. Hoover
Reviews.Content: It's small, really fast and takes better than average pictures for a point and shoot.  Love the wide angle for getting everyone in the shoot.  The large LCD display works fantastic so I don't miss the optical view finder at all.  The movies are unbelievable when shooting inside with only the table lamps on.  The camera feels well built with out being overweight or hard to handle.

Reviews.Title: Canon SD870IS
Reviews.Author: V. Vassalos
Reviews.Content: Crisp clear pictures, faithful colors. A big improvement over my old Canon S110. I miss the optical viewfinder.

Reviews.Title: Flash options
Reviews.Author: Kuotung Cheng
Reviews.Content: There are 3 flash options available:  auto / on / off, but they are available on the manual mode.  For auto mode, there are only 2 options:  auto and off.  You can not force the camera to use the flash while in the auto mode.  If this is a big deal to you, then do not buy this camera.  (This is a big deal to me, and I regret I bought this camera without this feature).Worst yet, the user guide is not clear:  On the page (page 71 of the user guide) that describes the flash function, it showed that these 3 flash options are available for both auto and manual mode.  But on another page (page 238, almost at the end of the user guide) that has a table to show the available functions in each of the shooting mode, the "on" function is not available in the auto mode.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but I prefer my old Powershot 10.
Reviews.Author: Harry Philips
Reviews.Content: Felt it smart to opt for the 8 mp and not go any higher ...  don't foresee having any of my pics made into posters!  Disappointed that it did NOT include a camera case - and the generic leather case I did buy isn't as handy as the old 'copper' case on the Powershot 10 - which I REALLY liked but felt it time to upgrade!  Like everything else, it has more 'bells and whistles' than I'll probably ever use  ... or understand!  I'll read the instruction book on the plane next trip out and perhaps I can avail myself of all the gimmicks each new generation makes available.  If it services me as well as the old Canon I'll be delighted!

Reviews.Title: could do better
Reviews.Author: C. Myers
Reviews.Content: When downloaded to the computer the pictures look nice. When the pictures are printed they are not sharp. I print better pictures with my kodak  easyshare camera I bought almost 5 years ago

Reviews.Title: Not too Sturdy!
Reviews.Author: David N. Cali
Reviews.Content: I Purchased this camera on Jan 1,2008. It takes OK pictures, nothing great. The camera broke yesterday, the lens will not retract! I tried bringing it to a camera repair shop but they said I had to send it back to Canon. I had to pay shipping & insurance to ship it to them. $20.00.  (I will never see that $20.00 again!!!) I have a Sony DSC P-100 that is 3 years old & NO PROBLEMS!

Reviews.Title: Not for butter fingers
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I searched many months for a camera.  Read review after review and test drove a few.  Purchased the SD870 IS and was a bit dissapointed by the picture quality (lots of red eye indoors no matter what mode) and the durability of the thing.  My husband had it in his pocket and cracked the LCD during a fishing trip.  It was not covered so I paid for the repair.  Then just the other day I dropped it not 3 feet from the ground while playing back the Halloween photos I took of my kids and poof the lens was dead.  The pieces just crumbled and this was on carpet and we do not have cement floors.  I am very unhappy with the quality and just wanted to let others know that if you have butter fingers (typically I do not have) then this camera is not for you.  One bounce and it is burnt TOAST.  I am back on the prowl for a "tough/waterproof" camera in hopes to avoid such problems in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Y. Chen
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for someone as a gift, it is a great product, love the lcd screen on the back. For its price, how can you go wrong.

Reviews.Title: CANNON POWERSHOT SD870 IS
Reviews.Author: A. Cinque
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot SD870IS 8MP Digital Camera with 3.8x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Silver)This is by far the worst camera I have ever purchased.  Unless you are in perfect lighting you have to adjust the camera to each and every setting.  The camera does have an auto setting, although it is useless.Thinking something was wrong with my camera, I called Cannon Customer Service I was told that you can not use auto in most light setting.  The representative advised that you have to go into the menu, select setting,  and adjust the camera for each setting.I am not a photographer and do not wish to be one.  If you are like me and expect a camera to take a good picture in all light setting while in the auto mode, do not purchase this one.  I have since purchase the Casio Exilim EX-S12 and love it!!  The Casio takes an excellent picture in all lighting situations and in "auto" mode.  There is no need to fumble to adjust the setting with the Castio and it is very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: WOW.. CANON DOES IT AGAIN !!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Segreti "LAWDOG"
Reviews.Content: I just upgraded my Canon SD 700IS Digital ELF with this SD 870IS. All I could say is this is the absolute best P/S camera in it's class. I also have a Nikon and Canon pro Slr and this little gem rivals both cameras. I also have had other P/S cameras like the Nikon, Sony and Sanyo, this 870IS blows them all away, by far !!! nothing even comes close to the ease of operation and picture quality. If your interested in the PERFECT P/S camera and are willing to pay a little more this is the camera for you. Like they say. "You Get What You pay For". This little wonder exceeded all my expectations by far. As a matter of fact I just ordered another one for my wife. Now stop reading this and order NOW !!!! I encourage ordering through Amazon, they have the best price and their customer service is outstanding. NOW ORDER IT !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Blurrry!
Reviews.Author: H.
Reviews.Content: After my (Great)Canon S60 fell for the last time I decided it was time for a new Canon. Because i have a 10D, and a 30D as well and they are great too, i am a canon man. That was a $300.00 mistake. every other picture is Blurry (with the image stablizer on or off). and i was just looking / comparing the old picrures by the S60, All the SD870is pic.s seemed blurry. It's time to give Nikon a chance. H.

Reviews.Title: Please help
Reviews.Author: Ceej
Reviews.Content: Hey Folks,I am facing a problem with this camera.  While flash pictures turn out great, anything taken without a flash comes out incredibly blurry and unrefined.  I have tried playing with all the settings and shooting modes even switching the camera into manual in order to play with iso, but still...blurry photos.  I read the reviews for this camera.  I want to believe so badly that this camera lives up to its 5 star rating on so many websites.  Does anyone know how to fix this low light issue?  If not, you will hear more from me in a scathing review to come....best,CJ

Reviews.Title: Canon did it again
Reviews.Author: Martin Kim "Trance4Life"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my sister cuz she's been taking my camera & using it for the longest time.  But b4 I handed over to her I've tested out to see the improvement.  Everything looked great including the picture quality but only thing I had trouble with was the touch-sensitive scroll button.  And since I'm not gonna use this camera, I don't really care.  I just hope she doesn't break it & ask for mine again.  That's a lil sis for ya.  I blame my parents for bring my lil sister into this world to continue to antagonize me.( of course I was just joking )  Anyways, hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: No shutter and aperture control and not happy with image quality.
Reviews.Author: George P. Dorian "snap shot"
Reviews.Content: I've been an amateur fine art photographer since the mid `80's.  This is my first digital camera.  I know a few professional photographers who have Canon cameras, so I assumed that I would be happy with a Canon.  I should say that I did buy it as just a "memory saver" and to take souvenir pics, but I was surprised that this camera does not have aperture and shutter controls; at least aperture and shutter priority controls.  This camera has more features then I would ever use, but it does not have the two most common features of a camera.  I do understand that this is an "automatic" camera, maybe designed for people who don't understand about aperture and shutter, but I still think it's a marketing blunder to not have such features.  I would have designed the camera for aperture and shutter priority controls with the default as all automatic.I'm also not happy about the quality of digital images.  There seems to be a "noise" issue with solid colors like sky.

Reviews.Title: Horizontial Black line across the LCD
Reviews.Author: T. Weight
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching cameras and found that the 870 IS best fit my needs.  Within a month after purchase, a small black horizontial line appeared in the middle of the LCD. Now after about a month, the line has extended completely across the screen and the thickness of the line has increased. The camera still takes good pictures, but it is extremely frustrating every time I take a picture.  I would not purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Need help with settings
Reviews.Author: M. Kim "cheo"
Reviews.Content: I just bought my first Canon camera, PowerShot SD 870IS.  It is very complex to use.  I have problems with indoor pictures. The background either comes out too dark (so does people in the background) or subjects come out too bright.  In addition, I have hard time getting the pictures of moving objects (especially kids) indoor and outdoor. I just want simple pictures how your naked eyes see the objects.  Canon camera is ruining the pictures by trying to accomodate for every different settings.  My 4 year old sony camera takes better pictures and I was able to capture every moments just like it is by simple point and shoot. I am soooo frustrated with Canon since I missed so many special moments. Many times, (espeically with kids) the special moments are just nano seconds long so I don't have the time to fiddle with settings, fuctions, and menus. So far with Canon, pictures came out too grainy, shadows, too dark, too bright and colors come out weird!!!  So, I need help, does anyone know ONE setting that works for every occasion and pictures come out just how you see it. I spent many hours to figure out but so far no good results  I would appreicate inputs.
